title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 27 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 27.

questions.question: How old was Jotham when he began to reign?
options: Twenty and five years old
Thirty years old
Twenty years old
Forty years old
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty and five years old
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:1 states that Jotham was twenty and five years old when he began to reign.

questions.question: Who was Jotham's mother?
options: Jerushah, the daughter of Zadok
Abigail, the daughter of Nahash
Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam
Naomi, the daughter of Elimelech
questions.correctAnswer: Jerushah, the daughter of Zadok
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:1 mentions that Jotham's mother's name was Jerushah, the daughter of Zadok.

questions.question: True or False: Jotham entered into the temple of the LORD during his reign.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:2 says that Jotham did not enter into the temple of the LORD.

questions.question: What did Jotham build according to 2 Chronicles 27:3?
options: The high gate of the house of the LORD and much on the wall of Ophel
A large palace in Jerusalem
A temple for the Ammonites
A vast marketplace
questions.correctAnswer: The high gate of the house of the LORD and much on the wall of Ophel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:3 states that Jotham built the high gate of the house of the LORD and much on the wall of Ophel.

questions.question: Where did Jotham build cities and castles?
options: In the mountains of Judah and in the forests
In the plains of Moab
Along the coast of the Mediterranean
In the deserts of Edom
questions.correctAnswer: In the mountains of Judah and in the forests
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:4 says Jotham built cities in the mountains of Judah, and castles and towers in the forests.

questions.question: Who did Jotham fight and prevail against?
options: The king of the Ammonites
The king of Egypt
The king of Assyria
The king of Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: The king of the Ammonites
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:5 states that Jotham fought with the king of the Ammonites and prevailed against them.

questions.question: What did the children of Ammon give Jotham after their defeat?
options: One hundred talents of silver, ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley
Gold and spices
Horses and chariots
Land and livestock
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred talents of silver, ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:5 describes that the children of Ammon paid Jotham one hundred talents of silver, ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Ammon paid Jotham tribute only in the first year after their defeat.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:5 says the children of Ammon paid tribute the first, second, and third years, not just the first year.

questions.question: Why did Jotham become mighty?
options: Because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God
Because he had a large army
Because he built many temples
Because he married into a royal family
questions.correctAnswer: Because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:6 says Jotham became mighty because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God.

questions.question: Where can the rest of Jotham's acts, wars, and ways be found?
options: In the book of the kings of Israel and Judah
In the book of the prophets
In the book of Psalms
In the book of the law
questions.correctAnswer: In the book of the kings of Israel and Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:7 states that the rest of Jotham's acts and wars are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.

questions.question: How long did Jotham reign in Jerusalem?
options: Sixteen years
Ten years
Twenty years
Twelve years
questions.correctAnswer: Sixteen years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:1 and 2 Chronicles 27:8 both mention that Jotham reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.

questions.question: True or False: Jotham was buried in the city of David.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:9 states that Jotham was buried in the city of David.

questions.question: Who reigned in Jotham’s place after he died?
options: Ahaz his son
Hezekiah his brother
Uzziah his father
Manasseh his grandson
questions.correctAnswer: Ahaz his son
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:9 says that Ahaz, Jotham’s son, reigned in his stead.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Chronicles 27:3: 'He built the high gate of the house of the LORD, and on the wall of ______ he built much.'
options: Ophel
Zion
Jerusalem
Bethlehem
questions.correctAnswer: Ophel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:3 states that Jotham built much on the wall of Ophel.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 27:2, how did Jotham's actions compare with his father Uzziah's?
options: He did that which was right according to all that his father did
He completely opposed his father's ways
He ignored his father's teachings
He followed a different religion than his father
questions.correctAnswer: He did that which was right according to all that his father did
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:2 states Jotham did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father Uzziah did.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is striving to lead a life pleasing to God in their family and work. Based on 2 Chronicles 27, what biblical truth would you share about preparing one's ways before the Lord?
options: Preparing one’s ways before the Lord leads to becoming mighty and successful.
Only outward religious acts are necessary to please God.
Ignoring God’s guidance leads to prosperity.
Success depends solely on human effort without God.
questions.correctAnswer: Preparing one’s ways before the Lord leads to becoming mighty and successful.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:6 states that Jotham became mighty because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God. This shows the importance of seeking God's guidance in life for true success.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 27 teach us about faithfulness in stewardship and building a strong foundation in spiritual and community life?
options: Jotham built the high gate of the house of the LORD and fortified cities and towers in Judah.
Jotham neglected physical and spiritual structures.
Building physical structures is more important than spiritual obedience.
Jotham focused only on military conquests, ignoring the temple.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham built the high gate of the house of the LORD and fortified cities and towers in Judah.
questions.explanation: Verses 3 and 4 describe Jotham’s work in building the high gate of the temple and fortifying cities, illustrating a practical example of stewardship and strengthening community and worship life.

questions.question: A believer faces temptation to neglect spiritual disciplines. According to 2 Chronicles 27, what example does Jotham provide about personal devotion and obedience?
options: Jotham did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, following his father’s example.
Jotham ignored God’s commands and led the people astray.
Jotham entered the temple daily to show his devotion.
Jotham focused only on military strength, neglecting spiritual matters.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, following his father’s example.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:2 reveals Jotham’s obedience in doing right before the LORD, learning from his father Uzziah's faithfulness, though he did not enter the temple himself.

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 27 teach about integrity and honesty in dealings with others?
options: Jotham’s victory over the Ammonites led to them paying him silver, wheat, and barley as tribute.
Jotham took spoils without a battle.
Jotham ignored enemies and did not engage in conflicts.
Jotham made unfair treaties with neighboring nations.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham’s victory over the Ammonites led to them paying him silver, wheat, and barley as tribute.
questions.explanation: Verse 5 shows that after fighting the Ammonites and prevailing, Jotham received tribute honestly, demonstrating integrity in victory and stewardship of resources.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because the people around them are acting corruptly. According to 2 Chronicles 27, how should one respond in such a situation?
options: Continue to do what is right in the sight of the LORD, even if others are corrupt.
Join in corrupt behavior to fit in with the people.
Ignore God’s ways because the people are corrupt.
Stop serving God until people change.
questions.correctAnswer: Continue to do what is right in the sight of the LORD, even if others are corrupt.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:2 notes that although the people were corrupt, Jotham did right before the LORD, teaching perseverance in obedience despite surrounding wickedness.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 27 model humility and contentment in leadership and family life?
options: Jotham acknowledged his mother and son, and his reign was recorded humbly in the book of kings.
Jotham boasted loudly of his achievements.
Jotham disrespected his parents and children.
Jotham ignored his family’s legacy.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham acknowledged his mother and son, and his reign was recorded humbly in the book of kings.
questions.explanation: Verses 1 and 9 mention Jotham’s mother Jerushah and his son Ahaz, showing respect for family and a humble acknowledgment of his reign, encouraging humility and gratitude.

questions.question: A believer wonders how to persevere through trials in leadership or service. What does 2 Chronicles 27 teach about perseverance and faith?
options: Jotham’s preparation before God and faithful service led to success despite challenges.
Jotham gave up when faced with difficulties.
Jotham ignored God during trials.
Trials are a sign to stop serving God.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham’s preparation before God and faithful service led to success despite challenges.
questions.explanation: Verse 6 highlights how Jotham’s success came because he prepared his ways before the LORD, teaching perseverance through faith and obedience.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 27, Jotham entered the temple of the LORD regularly as part of his devotion.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:2 states that Jotham did not enter the temple of the LORD, even though he did what was right in the sight of the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: Jotham reigned for sixteen years in Jerusalem and was buried in the city of David after his death.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 1, 8, and 9 confirm that Jotham reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem and was buried in the city of David.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jotham was _____ years old when he began to reign, and he reigned _____ years in Jerusalem.
options: twenty and five; sixteen
thirty; twenty
eighteen; ten
forty; fifteen
questions.correctAnswer: twenty and five; sixteen
questions.explanation: Verses 1 and 8 clearly state Jotham was twenty-five years old when he began to reign and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 27 illustrate the importance of gratitude and giving back to God through service and building His house?
options: Jotham built the high gate of the house of the LORD and fortified the wall of Ophel.
Jotham ignored the temple and focused only on warfare.
Jotham neglected the house of the LORD in his reign.
Jotham gave all his wealth to the king of Ammon.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham built the high gate of the house of the LORD and fortified the wall of Ophel.
questions.explanation: Verse 3 shows Jotham's commitment to building and enhancing the temple, reflecting gratitude and stewardship in serving God’s house.

questions.question: A believer is seeking to practice generosity. Based on 2 Chronicles 27, what can be learned about the blessings of faithful leadership and stewardship?
options: Jotham received tribute of silver, wheat, and barley from the children of Ammon for three years.
Jotham kept all spoils for himself without sharing.
Jotham refused to receive gifts from neighboring nations.
Jotham only focused on building walls and ignored blessings.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham received tribute of silver, wheat, and barley from the children of Ammon for three years.
questions.explanation: Verse 5 describes the material blessings Jotham received as a result of his faithful leadership, illustrating God's provision through stewardship.

questions.question: What biblical truth about family leadership can be drawn from 2 Chronicles 27 concerning legacy and parenting?
options: Jotham’s son Ahaz succeeded him as king, showing the importance of godly succession.
Jotham’s family was ignored and not mentioned.
Jotham’s son rebelled against him.
Jotham left no legacy for his children.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham’s son Ahaz succeeded him as king, showing the importance of godly succession.
questions.explanation: Verse 9 notes that Ahaz, Jotham’s son, reigned after him, emphasizing the value of raising children to continue godly leadership.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 27 demonstrate the connection between spiritual discipline and practical service in the community?
options: Jotham combined doing right before the LORD with building cities, castles, and towers.
Jotham focused only on spiritual matters and ignored community needs.
Jotham neglected spiritual devotion to focus on warfare.
Jotham’s reign was marked by neglect of both spiritual and physical duties.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham combined doing right before the LORD with building cities, castles, and towers.
questions.explanation: Verses 2, 3, and 4 show Jotham's balanced leadership involving spiritual obedience and practical strengthening of Judah’s communities.

questions.question: What practical Christian application about humility in leadership is taught in 2 Chronicles 27?
options: Jotham’s reign and actions are briefly recorded in the book of the kings, showing humility in legacy.
Jotham boasted extensively about his victories.
Jotham demanded constant praise and recognition.
Jotham refused to let others write about his reign.
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham’s reign and actions are briefly recorded in the book of the kings, showing humility in legacy.
questions.explanation: Verse 7 mentions that the rest of Jotham’s acts and wars are recorded in the book of kings, indicating a humble acceptance of record without self-exaltation.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 27.

questions.question: At what age did Jotham begin to reign according to 2 Chronicles 27?
options: Twenty-five years old
Thirty years old
Twenty years old
Sixteen years old
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-five years old
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:1 states that Jotham was twenty and five years old when he began to reign.

questions.question: Who was Jotham's mother and what is significant about her lineage?
options: Jerushah, daughter of Zadok
Abigail, daughter of Nahash
Bathsheba, daughter of Eliam
Maacah, daughter of Absalom
questions.correctAnswer: Jerushah, daughter of Zadok
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:1 identifies Jotham's mother as Jerushah, daughter of Zadok, linking Jotham to the Zadokite priestly line, which is significant in the religious context of Israel.

questions.question: Which action shows Jotham’s respect for the temple despite not entering it himself?
options: Building the high gate of the house of the LORD
Offering sacrifices daily
Leading public worship
Destroying pagan altars
questions.correctAnswer: Building the high gate of the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:3 states that Jotham built the high gate of the house of the LORD, showing his support for the temple infrastructure even though he did not enter it.

questions.question: How did Jotham’s reign reflect continuity with his father Uzziah’s reign?
options: He did what was right according to all his father Uzziah did
He expanded the borders into Egypt
He destroyed the temple of the LORD
He allied with the king of Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: He did what was right according to all his father Uzziah did
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:2 emphasizes that Jotham did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, following the example of his father Uzziah, showing a thematic continuation of righteous leadership.

questions.question: What military achievement did Jotham accomplish against the Ammonites?
options: He prevailed against the king of the Ammonites
He was defeated by the Ammonites
He formed a peace treaty with the Ammonites
He ignored the Ammonites
questions.correctAnswer: He prevailed against the king of the Ammonites
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:5 records that Jotham fought and prevailed against the king of the Ammonites, a significant military victory that brought tribute.

questions.question: What tribute did the children of Ammon pay to Jotham after their defeat?
options: One hundred talents of silver, ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley
Fifty talents of gold and five thousand sheep
One hundred camels and a thousand horses
No tribute was paid
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred talents of silver, ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:5 details this specific tribute as a sign of submission and wealth gained through military success.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 27:6, why did Jotham become mighty?
options: Because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God
Because he built a large army
Because he married a foreign princess
Because he conquered Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes the theological principle that Jotham’s success was due to his faithful preparation and obedience before God.

questions.question: What does the mention of the 'book of the kings of Israel and Judah' in verse 7 imply about the historical record?
options: That Jotham’s deeds were recorded in a royal annal separate from Chronicles
That Chronicles is the only source of his reign
That Jotham’s reign was not documented anywhere
That the book was written by Jotham himself
questions.correctAnswer: That Jotham’s deeds were recorded in a royal annal separate from Chronicles
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:7 refers to additional historical records, indicating that the Chronicler used existing royal archives to compile his history.

questions.question: Which cities or structures did Jotham build according to this chapter?
options: Cities in the mountains of Judah, castles and towers in the forests
Pyramids in Egypt
Walls around Babylon
Palaces in Samaria
questions.correctAnswer: Cities in the mountains of Judah, castles and towers in the forests
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:4 describes Jotham’s construction projects, emphasizing his role in fortifying Judah's defensive and urban structures.

questions.question: Why did Jotham not enter the temple of the LORD even though he did what was right?
options: Because of his father's leprosy, which may have disqualified him ceremonially
Because he rejected the temple worship
Because the temple was destroyed
Because he was not king yet
questions.correctAnswer: Because of his father's leprosy, which may have disqualified him ceremonially
questions.explanation: While the text in 2 Chronicles 27:2 only states he did not enter, cross-reference with 2 Chronicles 26 explains Uzziah’s leprosy, which likely affected Jotham’s temple access, highlighting ritual purity laws and priestly boundaries.

questions.question: How long did Jotham reign in Jerusalem?
options: Sixteen years
Twenty years
Ten years
Thirty years
questions.correctAnswer: Sixteen years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:1 and 2 Chronicles 27:8 clearly state Jotham reigned for sixteen years in Jerusalem.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jotham being buried in the city of David?
options: It shows his legitimate royal lineage and connection to Davidic covenant
It was an unusual burial place for kings
It indicates he was a priest
It means he was not recognized as king
questions.correctAnswer: It shows his legitimate royal lineage and connection to Davidic covenant
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:9 mentions Jotham’s burial in the city of David, symbolizing his rightful place in the Davidic dynasty and fulfillment of covenant promises.

questions.question: Who succeeded Jotham as king after his death?
options: Ahaz his son
Hezekiah his brother
Uzziah his father
Zedekiah his cousin
questions.correctAnswer: Ahaz his son
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:9 states that Ahaz, Jotham’s son, reigned in his stead after Jotham’s death.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 27:2, the people during Jotham’s reign were completely righteous.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:2 indicates that while Jotham did right, the people still acted corruptly, showing a contrast between the king and the populace.

questions.question: What does Jotham’s preparation of his ways before the LORD (v.6) typologically foreshadow in the broader biblical narrative?
options: The Messianic ideal of a righteous king who walks before God
The failure of Israel to keep the covenant
The exile of Judah to Babylon
The destruction of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The Messianic ideal of a righteous king who walks before God
questions.explanation: Jotham’s righteous preparation before the LORD anticipates the ideal king motif fulfilled ultimately in the Messiah, who perfectly obeys and honors God.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 27, what was the age of Jotham when he began to reign, and how long did he reign in Jerusalem?
options: Twenty-five years old; reigned sixteen years
Thirty years old; reigned twenty years
Twenty years old; reigned fifteen years
Thirty-five years old; reigned ten years
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-five years old; reigned sixteen years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:1 and 2 Chronicles 27:8 clearly state that Jotham was twenty-five years old when he began to reign and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. This highlights the biblical pattern of God raising up young leaders to steward His covenant people (cf. 1 Kings 15:7; Psalm 127:3; Ecclesiastes 12:1).

questions.question: What was Jotham's relationship to his mother as mentioned in the chapter?
options: His mother was Jerushah, daughter of Zadok
His mother was Athaliah, daughter of Omri
His mother was Bathsheba, wife of David
His mother was Abijah, daughter of Zechariah
questions.correctAnswer: His mother was Jerushah, daughter of Zadok
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:1 identifies Jotham's mother as Jerushah, daughter of Zadok. Zadok's priestly lineage links Jotham to the Levitical priesthood, underscoring God's providential preservation of the Davidic and priestly lines (cf. 1 Chronicles 6:8-15; Ezekiel 44:15; Hebrews 7:1-3).

questions.question: How did Jotham conduct himself in the sight of the LORD during his reign?
options: He did right, following the example of his father Uzziah
He did evil and led Israel into idolatry
He forsook the temple and worshiped foreign gods
He ruled without regard to the LORD's commands
questions.correctAnswer: He did right, following the example of his father Uzziah
questions.explanation: Verse 2 states Jotham did what was right in the sight of the LORD, following all that his father Uzziah did. This reveals the biblical principle of godly legacy and faithfulness to the covenant (cf. Deuteronomy 6:4-7; 2 Kings 15:34; Hebrews 11:32-38).

questions.question: Despite Jotham's righteousness, what problem among the people is highlighted in the chapter?
options: The people still acted corruptly
They fully repented and worshiped God sincerely
They built new altars to the LORD
They refused to pay tribute to Ammon
questions.correctAnswer: The people still acted corruptly
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:2 notes that although Jotham did right, the people still acted corruptly. This reflects the persistent sinfulness of humanity and the need for divine intervention (cf. Romans 3:23; Jeremiah 17:9; Isaiah 64:6).

questions.question: Which significant construction projects did Jotham undertake for the house of the LORD?
options: He built the high gate and fortified the wall of Ophel
He tore down the temple and built a new one
He built an altar for foreign gods
He neglected all temple repairs
questions.correctAnswer: He built the high gate and fortified the wall of Ophel
questions.explanation: Verse 3 tells that Jotham built the high gate of the house of the LORD and strengthened the wall of Ophel. This shows his dedication to the security and worship of God's sanctuary (cf. Nehemiah 3:1; Ezra 9:9; Psalm 48:12-13).

questions.question: In addition to Jerusalem, where else did Jotham build cities and fortifications?
options: In the mountains of Judah and the forests
In the plains of Moab
Along the Mediterranean coast
In the northern kingdom of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: In the mountains of Judah and the forests
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:4 records that Jotham built cities in the mountains of Judah and castles and towers in the forests, reflecting his role as a protector and builder of God's people and territory (cf. Joshua 15:1-63; 2 Kings 14:13; Psalm 127:1).

questions.question: What was the outcome of Jotham's conflict with the king of the Ammonites?
options: Jotham prevailed and received tribute of silver, wheat, and barley
Jotham was defeated and lost territory
They formed an alliance without battle
The Ammonites destroyed Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: Jotham prevailed and received tribute of silver, wheat, and barley
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states that Jotham defeated the Ammonites, who then paid him one hundred talents of silver, ten thousand measures of wheat, and barley for three years. This demonstrates God's providential blessing and vindication of His king (cf. 2 Samuel 8:1; Psalm 18:39; Isaiah 10:5-6).

questions.question: How did Jotham become mighty according to the text?
options: Because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God
Because he formed many alliances with foreign nations
Because he amassed great wealth through trade
Because he neglected the temple worship
questions.correctAnswer: Because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states Jotham's might came because he prepared his ways before the LORD. This aligns with biblical teaching on human responsibility and God's sovereign blessing (cf. Proverbs 16:3; Psalm 37:5; James 4:7).

questions.question: Where can one find additional details about Jotham's acts, wars, and ways?
options: In the book of the kings of Israel and Judah
In the Psalms of David
In the prophetic writings of Isaiah alone
In the apocryphal books
questions.correctAnswer: In the book of the kings of Israel and Judah
questions.explanation: Verse 7 mentions that the rest of Jotham's acts and wars are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah, highlighting the biblical practice of chronicling God's covenant history (cf. 1 Kings 14:19; 2 Kings 8:11; Luke 1:1-4).

questions.question: What does the burial of Jotham in the city of David signify in a theological context?
options: His legitimate place in the Davidic covenant lineage
That he was rejected by God and buried dishonorably
That he was not a true king of Judah
That he was a foreigner with no claim to the throne
questions.correctAnswer: His legitimate place in the Davidic covenant lineage
questions.explanation: Verse 9 states Jotham was buried in the city of David, affirming his place in the covenant promises established with David (cf. 2 Samuel 7:12-16; Psalm 89:3-4; Luke 1:32-33). This burial signifies God's faithfulness to His messianic covenant.

questions.question: Who succeeded Jotham as king after his death?
options: Ahaz, his son
Hezekiah, his brother
Uzziah, his father
Manasseh, his nephew
questions.correctAnswer: Ahaz, his son
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 27:9 identifies Ahaz as Jotham's son and successor, continuing the Davidic line. This succession points to the biblical theme of dynastic continuity and God's providential plan for His people (cf. 2 Kings 16:1; Isaiah 7:1; Matthew 1:8).

questions.question: Why is Jotham's refusal to enter the temple of the LORD significant despite his righteousness?
options: It reflects reverence for the LORD's holiness and boundaries
It shows disobedience and pride
It indicates he was unworthy and rejected by God
It demonstrates neglect of worship duties
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects reverence for the LORD's holiness and boundaries
questions.explanation: Verse 2 notes Jotham did not enter the temple, which can be understood as respect for God's holiness and the Levitical priestly roles. This aligns with biblical emphasis on God's holiness and human reverence (cf. Exodus 3:5; Leviticus 10:1-3; Hebrews 12:28).

questions.question: What theological truth is illustrated by the Ammonites paying tribute to Jotham after their defeat?
options: God's providence in establishing His servant's dominion
The futility of trusting in human military strength alone
The irrelevance of covenant faithfulness
The dominance of pagan gods over Israel
questions.correctAnswer: God's providence in establishing His servant's dominion
questions.explanation: Verse 5 shows the Ammonites paying tribute, illustrating that God sovereignly establishes and blesses His anointed king. This accords with Scripture's teaching on divine sovereignty over nations (cf. Daniel 2:21; Psalm 2:7-9; Romans 13:1).

questions.question: How does Jotham's reign contribute to the biblical theme of covenant faithfulness?
options: By doing right before the LORD and building the temple's gates
By abandoning God's covenant and leading idolatry
By neglecting the temple and forsaking worship
By allying with pagan nations against God
questions.correctAnswer: By doing right before the LORD and building the temple's gates
questions.explanation: Jotham's faithfulness, as recorded in verses 2 and 3, manifests covenant loyalty through righteous behavior and temple restoration. This echoes the biblical call to covenant obedience (cf. Deuteronomy 28; Nehemiah 2:17-18; John 14:15).

questions.question: What does Jotham’s construction of towers and fortifications reveal about the nature of God’s kingdom as portrayed in this chapter?
options: God’s kingdom requires both spiritual and practical stewardship
God’s kingdom is only spiritual with no earthly concerns
God’s kingdom rejects all forms of defense and protection
God’s kingdom is limited to heavenly realms only
questions.correctAnswer: God’s kingdom requires both spiritual and practical stewardship
questions.explanation: Verse 4 shows Jotham building cities, castles, and towers, indicating that God's kingdom involves responsible governance, protection, and provision alongside worship (cf. Nehemiah 4:14; Proverbs 21:31; Matthew 22:21).
